data.title: 15 Best Dog Movies For Kids
data.meta_description: Most people love dogs, due to their lovable and trustworthy nature. Dog movies are always a hit with them. Here is a list of dog movies that are meant for kids.
data.text:
Dogs have proven time and time again that they are a man’s best friend. They easily adapt to families and become close with the kids in the house as well. It is due to this reason that kids love dogs as well. Kids usually love dog movies, and it is a good way to teach your kids about animals, how to treat them, and how to be gentle with them. Plus, dog movies for kids are an excellent way to spend time with kids and bond with them. We have a list of kid’s movies with dogs that your little one is sure to love. Let’s get started, shall we?

15 Finest Kid-Friendly Dog Films

1. Marley and Me

Source: Pinterest

Rated: PG

Platform to Watch: YouTube, Amazon Prime Video, Google Play

Description

Marley and Me is a very popular 00’s dog movies for children and is based off a book of the same name by John Grogan. It’s about a couple that adopts an ill-behaved Labrador, who they eventually learn to love and live with. It follows the life of the dog through the various milestones that it achieves. It is a wonderful kids movie about a dog with comedy, drama and will teach your kids about love and grief in great depth. Make sure to keep some tissues because this one is a real tearjerker.

2. 101 Dalmations

Source: Pinterest

Rated: G

Platform to Watch: YouTube, Amazon Prime Video, Apple TV

Description

101 Dalmatians is a great movie from the 90s and based on the novel of the same name written by Dodie Smith in 1956. It follows the story of a litter of Dalmatian puppies that get kidnapped by the villain, Cruella de Vil because she wants a coat made out of their fur. Their parents set out to rescue them and in doing so, end up saving over eighty-four other pups, which bring the total to 101. It is a beautiful movie to watch for kids and involves a lot of funny bits as well.

3. Benji

Source: Pinterest

Rated: G

Platform to Watch: Netflix

Description

Benji is a great movie from 1974 about a stray dog that has no owner and prefers to roam around the streets of a small Texan town. He gets by because of handouts from the local shopkeeper, plays with kids who like him and vice versa and has a ball poking fun at the cat of a resident. One day, the kids that he plays with get kidnapped and now it is up to Benji to save the day and rescue the kids from mean kidnappers.

4. Beethoven

Source: Pinterest

Rated: PG

Platform to Watch: Amazon Prime Video, Google Play, Apple TV

Description

Beethoven is a classic 90s movie about a giant, slobbering, lovable St. Bernard who is clumsy and, yet, loved dearly by the family it is adopted by, except the father. The dog narrowly escapes dognappers and ends up as the focus of an evil vet who wants to conduct experiments. Turns out, the father is the one who is the dog’s last resort. This movie is an absolute hit with kids who love the clumsy, fluffy, giant dog.

5. A Dog’s Purpose

Source: Pinterest

Rated: PG

Platform to Watch: Amazon Prime Video, Netflix

Description

A Dog’s Purpose is a relatively new movie. It released in 2017 and is about a dog that discovers the meaning of its existence by being reincarnated four times with different owners. The incidents and experiences in each lifetime teach the dog about itself and it understands its real purpose. He also develops a bond with a boy named Ethan and as the boy grows older, the dog returns to remind him of his true self. It is a very moving film about dogs and the relationships they share with their owners.

6. My Dog Skip

Source: Pinterest

Rated: G

Platform to Watch: Amazon Prime Video

Description

The late Willie Morris bases this movie off a memoir of the same name. It is about a wonderful relationship between a lonely boy growing up in the 40s and his new Fox Terrier, Skip. His life changes for the better after Skip. This movie is a real tearjerker and shows the kind of special relationship a boy can have with his pet dog.

7. Lady and the Tramp

Source: Pinterest

Rated: G

Platform to Watch: Disney Hotstar

Description

This animated movie by Disney, made in 1955, follows the life of a pampered dog called Lady and how she starts getting ignored by her owners once they have a baby. She winds up on the street and ends up befriending a rough mutt named Tramp. This movie shows the love story that follows but not without its troubles when there is more drama at Lady’s house.

8. Isle Of Dogs

Source: Pinterest

Rated: PG

Platform to Watch: YouTube, Google Play, Amazon Prime Video, Apple TV

Description

This 2018 movie made by the quirky director Wes Anderson, follows the adventurous story of a boy who is determined to bring back his dog, Spots after every dog in the city is exiled after a canine flu outbreak. It is a great dog and kid’s movie to show your kids to enhance their sense of wonder and adventure.

9. The Shaggy Dog

Source: Pinterest

Rated: PG

Platform to Watch: YouTube, Google Play, Amazon Prime Video, Apple TV

Description

Dave Douglas is a district attorney who is a workaholic. When he is injected with a secret mutation serum, it transforms him into a dog. He must now find the villains and make sure that he can get converted back to a human. Living the life of a dog gives him a new perspective towards his family and what is important in his life.

10. The Secret Life of Pets

Source: Pinterest

Rated: PG

Platform to Watch: Netflix, Jio Cinema, Amazon Prime Video, ZEE5, Apple TV

Description

Max is a spoiled terrier living in New York and his owner adopts a giant dog named Duke. One day, while out for a walk, they encounter a bunch of stray cats and wind up in the dog pound. Lucky for them, a bunny named Snowball saves them and demands that they join his gang of other abandoned pets on an objective against the owners who have done them wrong.

11. Hachi: A Dog’s Tale

Rated: PG

Platform to Watch: Amazon Prime Video

Description

Inspired by the true story of Hachiko from Japan, Hachi: A Dog’s Tale is an adapted version that narrates the story of a very loving and faithful dog who arrives at the train station for his master, Professor Parker Wilson. Even after his master’s demise, the dog continues to wait for him for 10 long years.

12. Eight Below

Rated: PG

Platform to Watch: Amazon Prime Video, Apple TV, Google Play

Description

Eight Below is Walt Disney’s one of the most adventurous tales of survival, friendship, and companionship of eight sled dogs and two Antarctic explorers. How the dogs meet the survival of the fittest and how they navigate through the coldest winter of the Antarctic makes the movie worth the watch. Get ready some of out-the-seat action and emotional crying!

13. Togo

Rated: PG

Platform to Watch: Disney Hotstar

Description

Featuring Academy Awards Nominee Willem Dafoe and Julianne Nicholson, Togo is by the century’s most pulse-racing movie based on an untold true story set in the winters of 1925 when the Alaskan tundra faced an epidemic. Narrating infinite courage, determination, and strength, the movie Togo is an emotional adventure and definitely an inspiration for children.

14. A Dog’s Way Home

Rated: PG

Platform to Watch: Netflix, Amazing Prime Video, YouTube, Apple TV

Description

Based on a best-selling novel, A Dog’s Way Home, the movie narrates the exciting adventure of Bella, a loving dog who gets separated from her owner emabarks on a long journey of exploration and adventure thrugh the wilderness of Colorado. The movies showcases the infinite love and connection between Bella and her owner, making it an inspiring story for all animal lovers.

15. The Call of the Wild

Rated: PG

Platform to Watch: Disney Hotstar, Apple TV, Amazing Prime

Description

Based on the literary classic novel, the movie The Call of the Wind tells the tale of a courageous and witted dog, Buck, whose life turns upside down when he is sold from his California home and reaches the wilderness of the Yukon during the Klondike Gold Rush of 1890s. The movie beautifully captures the unspoken understanding and truth between a man and his dog, and the enduring goodness of the human spirit.

FAQs

1. Are animal movies safe for children to watch?

Yes, children’s movies based on cats, dogs, birds, hamsters, and fish are safe for kids to watch. Just make sure they are categorised under the children’s age appropriate.

2. How can parents choose dog movies that are appropriate for toddlers and children?

Parents can look for a movie’s ratings, summary, reviews, and age preferences when selecting children’s dog movies for their children.

3. What qualities can movies on dogs teach children?

Kids movies with dogs teach children the art of compassion, selflessness, companionship, friendship, and trust. They can be a great way of learning for kids about adventure and emotions.

Dog movies are great for kids and adults alike. Puppy movie for kids is made such that they are not only fun but also have a message at the end and help teach the kids about something as well. Make sure to round up your entire family this coming weekend and watch some of the movies that we have listed. Enjoy your movie night!
